The first students enrolled in January 1971, and the university administration is based at Walton Hall, Milton Keynes, in Buckinghamshire. The Open University was the world's first successful distance teaching university and used television to broadcast teaching programs. The university awards undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, as well as non-degree qualifications such as diplomas and certificates or continuing education units.
